meanings.definition: To put together in a single group or mass.
meanings.sent1: She lumped all her toys into one box.
meanings.sent2: The teacher lumped the students into two teams for the game.
meanings.sent3: He lumped all the ingredients together and made a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: The artist lumped different colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The gardener lumped the flowers in a stunning bouquet.

meanings.definition: To treat as a single unit.
meanings.sent1: The manager lumped all the tasks for the day.
meanings.sent2: She lumped all the expenses into one report.
meanings.sent3: He lumped all the chores on his lazy brother.
meanings.sent4: The chef lumped the ingredients to make a perfect dish.
meanings.sent5: The scientist lumped the data to draw a clear conclusion.

meanings.sent1: The tired hiker lumped along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The elephant lumped through the jungle.
meanings.sent3: He lumped around the room looking for his keys.
meanings.sent4: The robot lumped across the room in a funny manner.
meanings.sent5: The bear lumped through the snow in search of food.
